name: Men of War: Red Tide
description: Men of War: Red Tide is a sequel to the critically acclaimed RTS Men of War. Red Tide introduces a new story driven campaign based on the writings of Soviet scribe Alexander Zorich, it also includes dozens of new or upgraded units and weapons.

Red Tide is the second chapter in the Men of War series, presenting WWII engagements from the Russian perspective, refreshingly. There are some subtle improvements over the original. Large battles in particular are much easier... you are given a relatively small force to command, and the AI forces will advance as you do. It is strictly a single player campaign, with some challenging maps, even on easy. I love the game despite its difficulty. When you are intimately familiar with the controls, and nimble with the view options, every engagement is a treat visially and tactically. The only thing I would ask for is a replay option that records your battle and then allows you to observe the battle later or share with friends. Hopefully that option will appear in the Vietnam version due later this year.
